page.title: 15Freddie Festival Mascot
page.content: A famous local personality was born in Dilhorne not long ago. He is Freddie who rose to stardom when he was featured in the children's book: "FREDDIE and the STAR of AFRICA" Freddie was created by husband and wife Francis and Shelia Wainwright for their daughter Victoria who attends Dilhorne School.The children were fascinated to hear how a book is written and produced and even more astonished to find out that Freddie had been chosen as the mascot for Stoke on Trent's National Garden Festival to be held in 1986. The Festival is to be held on the old Shelton Iron & Steel Works grounds and it is hoped it will be as succesful as that of the Liverpool Festival held in 1984.Many new jobs have been created and Freddie has had a new adventurte in "Freddie and the Bank of England Mystery".
